channel.title: Email Spoofing technique
channel.description: Hi, I'm new to cybersecurity and hacking. Lately I've encountered a type of "attack" in my opinion very interesting and I would like to understand more. The attack in question takes the name of "Email Spoofing" and it consists in being able to send an email to a certain address using a "fake" one. When I saw the attack, the "hacker" was able to send an e-mail from the same address of the recipient. I've looked for a bit on the internet and I saw solutions that used SET (kali linux) and an external service like smtp server, but they don't seem to work. I would like to know if anyone knows anything more, Thanks.

item.title: Email Spoofing technique
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed 3 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Email Spoofing technique
item.dc:creator: _J4ck
item.description:
Hi, I’m new to cybersecurity and hacking. Lately I’ve encountered a type of “attack” in my opinion very interesting and I would like to understand more. The attack in question takes the name of “Email Spoofing” and it consists in being able to send an email to a certain address using a “fake” one. When I saw the attack, the “hacker” was able to send an e-mail from the same address of the recipient. I’ve looked for a bit on the internet and I saw solutions that used SET (kali linux) and an external service like smtp server, but they don’t seem to work. I would like to know if anyone knows anything more, Thanks.

Read full topic
